III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12320 Supervision
Section (1) An agency shall ensure an appropriate level of care and
Description supervision for the foster child at all times consistent with a child’s
age, level of functioning, and treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency failed to provide supervision of a child
at a hospital.
Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 04/24/2025. Staff 1 is
a staff member at Eagle Village. Staff 1 reported Foster Child A
was placed at Eagle Village residential until 04/20/2025 when she
then entered into a local Hospital. Foster Child A is twelve years
old. Staff 1 reported Eagle Village had submitted a thirty day
notice for removal of Foster Child A. Staff 1 reported Foster Child
A was having suicidal ideations and anxiety and required
hospitalization. Staff 1 reported Foster Child A was discharged
from Eagle Village during the day on 04/20/2025. Staff 1 reported
Foster Child A was discharged into the care of D.A. Blodgett on
04/20/2025 and Eagle Village was coordinating with D.A. Blodgett
to provide supervision for Foster Child A while she was at the
hospital, starting at 6:00pm on 04/20/2025. Staff 1 reported she
was with Foster Child A at the hospital until 6:00pm on 04/20/2025
and while she was coordinating with D.A. Blodgett for additional
coverage. Staff 1 reported she was coordinating coverage with the
D.A Blodgett On Call Worker. Staff 1 reported hospital staff had
informed her she and Eagle Village would not be allowed to
provide coverage for Foster Youth A past 6:00pm as they no
longer held the case.
Staff 1 reported Foster Child A was nervous about being at the
hospital without known staff and had asked her if she would
contact D.A. Blodgett to see if someone would come to the
hospital and sit with her. Staff 1 reported she relayed this
information to D.A. Blodgett Chief Administrator via email.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
04/25/2025. Chief Administrator reported hospital staff had
informed D.A. Blodgett that supervision of Foster Child A was not
needed by D.A. Blodgett after 6:00pm on 04/20/2025 as the
hospital had a sitter who could stay with Foster Child A while she
was at the hospital. Chief Administrator reported Network 180 had
2

authorized admission of Foster Child A for inpatient hospitalization
at the hospital.
D.A. Blodgett Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via
phone on 06/16/2025. Foster Care Supervisor reported Foster
Child A was admitted to the hospital on 04/20/2025. Foster Care
Supervisor reported Eagle Village staff could no longer sit with
Foster Child A past 6:00pm on 04/20/2025 as at that time they no
longer held responsibility for the case. Foster Care Supervisor
reported D. A. Blodgett On Call Worker had been coordinating
with Eagle Village in providing supervision of Foster Child A while
she was at the hospital.
Foster Care Supervisor reported her first face to face contact with
Foster Child A after she was admitted to the hospital was on
04/25/2025 at Osceola Youth Center. Foster Child A had been
discharged from the hospital on 04/22/2025 and admitted to
Osceola Youth Center on the same day. Foster Care Supervisor
confirmed that visits to Foster Child A from D.A. Blodgett while
she was at the local Hospital did not occur. Foster Care
Supervisor reported the hospital social worker stated the hospital
would provide coverage as Foster Child A was to be admitted to
the hospital. Foster Care Supervisor confirmed that the first
agency visit to Foster Child A since she was discharged from
Eagle Village occurred on 04/25/2025.
D. A. Blodgett On Call Worker, hereafter referred to as “On
Call Worker”, was interviewed via telephone on 06/18/2025.
On Call Worker reported she was in contact with Eagle Village on
04/20/2025, as D.A. Blodgett was to take over supervision of
Foster Child A starting at 6:00pm on 04/20/25. On Call Worker
reported she was in contact with the hospital social worker at
4:20pm on 04/20/2025 and the hospital social worker informed her
that D.A. Blodgett did not need to provide supervision of Foster
Child A as she was being admitted to inpatient. On Call Worker
reported that prior to this, the agency had planned to provide
supervision of Foster Child A, but since she was admitted,
supervision was not required but recommended by the hospital.
Youth A was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 07/17/2025.
Youth A is 12 years old. Youth A reported she went to the hospital
from Eagle Village on Easter Sunday as she was self harming by
cutting. Youth A reported when she was hospitalized she had
asked Staff 1 if she would please call D. A. Blodgett and ask if her
worker, the Foster Care Supervisor, would come to the hospital to
be with her. Youth A reported that she was upset, feeling lonely,
3

and wanted her worker to be with her. Youth A reported she is
close to her worker and would have felt better if her worker had
come to the hospital. Youth A reported that her worker or any
other staff did not come to the hospital.
Documentation Review
A series of emails were reviewed and are as follows:
An email dated 04/20/2025 at 6:06:26pm from Staff 1 to D.A.
Blodgett Chief Administrator, Foster Care Supervisor and others
describes Staff 1’s concern that Foster Child A is nervous to stay
alone at the hospital and she asked her if someone from D.A.
Blodgett can come and be with her. The email further documents
that the hospital stated it is not required for a staff from D.A,
Blodgett to sit with Foster Child A but it is recommended. Staff 1
asked if D. A. Blodgett can provide a staff to sit with Foster Child A
while at the hospital.
An email dated 04/20/2025 at 5:07pm from D.A. Blodgett On Call
Supervisor to D.A. Blodgett Chief Administrator and Foster Care
Supervisor states in part that the On Call Worker had confirmed
with the hospital that it is not required for a staff to be there with
Foster Child A at the hospital. The email further documents On
Call Worker reached out to the team and no one from D. A.
Blodgett will be sitting with Foster Child A that night.
An email dated 04/20/2025 at 1:08:11pm from D.A. Blodgett On
Call Supervisor to D.A. Blodgett Chief Administrator and Foster
Care supervisor as well as others indicates that the agency has
staff assigned to sit with Foster Child A the evening of 04/20/2025.
A series of emails dated 04/20/2025 and 04/21/2025 from the
Eagle Village Vice President of Treatment Programs asks, in part,
if D. A. Blodgett could put Eagle Village on a visitors list for Foster
Child A as she is concerned about Foster Child A feeling
abandoned at the hospital.
An email dated 06/18/2025 from Chief Administrator reports that
D.A. Blodgett is required to be at the hospital with a foster child if
the child is not being admitted to inpatient. If the child is admitted
the hospital takes the lead in supervision and they follow what
they say. The email further states that if a child is admitted and the
hospital does not require an agency staff to be there, the agency
still visits the child but does not stay around the clock.
4

Foster Care File: A review of the file indicates that D. A. Blodgett
has held responsibility for the case since 2019. The file
documents admission to the Hospital on 04/20/2025 and
discharged to Osceola Youth Center on 04/22/2025.The file
documents a number of hospitalizations for aggression and
mental health concerns.
Analysis Foster Care Child asked Staff 1 if she could contact D. A. Blodgett
and have a staff come and sit with her while she was at the
hospital as she was nervous to stay alone. Staff 1 reported this to
the D.A. Blodgett Chief Administrator and the Foster Care
Supervisor via email on 04/20/2025.
The email from Chief Administrator to this Consultant states an
agency staff would visit a child in the hospital even when not
required. D. A. Blodgett staff did not visit Foster Child A during the
evening of 04/20/2025 or on 04/21/2025.
Foster Child A reported she asked Staff 1 to call her D. A. Blodgett
Worker, Foster Care Supervisor, to ask if she would come to be
with her at the hospital as she was upset and feeling lonely.
Foster Child A reported she would have felt better if her worker
would have been with her at the hospital. Foster Child A reported
her worker or any other D. A. Blodgett staff did not come to be
with her.
Foster Child A is a twelve year old who was in crises and should
have had a staff person known to her from D. A. Blodgett visit and
support her during the evening of 04/20/2025.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an approved corrective action plan the recommendation is for
continuance of the regular license.
